$$Y_{ij} = (\beta_0  + \mu_{0j}) + (\beta_1 + \mu_{1j})\bf{time_{ij}} + \beta_2 SNP_j + \epsilon_{ij}$$
$$\epsilon_{ij} \sim N(0, \sigma_{\epsilon ij}^2)$$
$$\sigma_{\epsilon ij} = exp(\alpha + \tau \bf{SNP}_j)$$
$$\begin{bmatrix} \mu_{0j} \\ \mu_{1j} \\ \end{bmatrix} \sim N(0, \Omega)$$
$$\Omega = \begin{bmatrix} \sigma_{\mu0j}^2 & \\ \sigma_{\mu01j} & \sigma_{\mu1j}^2 \\ \end{bmatrix}$$

NOTE: I removed the \^2 in $\sigma_{\epsilon ij}$ since the function
stats::rnorm takes the standard deviation not variance in the data
generating process. Similarly, nlme::lme returns the SD and not the
variance in modmer objects.
